text: Upon the designation of a drug free zone, the Police Department shall mark each block within the drug free zone by using barriers, tape, or police officers that post the following information in the immediate area of, and borders around, the drug free zone:
historical:
Prior Codifications

1981 Ed., § 33-583.

Emergency Act Amendments

For temporary addition of subchapter, see note to § 48-1001.

Legislative History of Laws

For legislative history of D.C. Law 11-270, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 48-1001.

DC CODE § 48-1003

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: A statement that it is unlawful for a person to congregate in a group of 2 or more persons for the purposes of participating in the use, purchase, or sale of illegal drugs within the boundaries of a drug free zone, and to fail to disperse after being instructed to disperse by a uniformed officer of the Police Department who reasonably believes the person is congregating for the purpose of participating in the use, purchase, or sale of illegal drugs;
The boundaries of the drug free zone;
A statement of the effective dates of the drug free zone designation; and
Any other additional notice to inform the public of the drug free zone.

heading.catch_text: Notice of a drug free zone.
